This is a perfect game for your mind.

Portal 2 takes place after the events of the first Portal game and is much more story driven than the first game.  It has new more define characters, new gameplay mechanics and a co-op mode that lets you solve puzzles with a second player.

The single player has the player travel through the ruins of Aperture Science after the finale of Portal.  The player also travels to the old test chambers from the 1960â€™s onward.  Portal 2 manage to tell a good story completely through audio logs, messages, and from non-human characters like Wheatley, an AI core you meet early on in the game.  The story is very enjoyable and the gameplay is a much more polished from the first game however there are several story sections that do not involve solving puzzles which can be a take away for some players.

The co-op campaign is more in tune with the first game.  Instead of being more story based itâ€™s more focused on the puzzles.  You play as two robots that have to work together solving different test chambers.  The co-op really requires communication and teamwork to solve the puzzles but can be very rewarding if you have a good co-op partner.

Portal 2 is good sequel that refines existing gameplay mechanics, improves on several different areas and does not lose too much in the process.  If you liked Portal then youâ€™ll like the sequel, for some people not as much but it is still a fun puzzle game to play.

Late to the party. 

One of the funniest single player games you can find, amazing writing, voice over and puzzle designs. Widely considered one of the best games ever made, and you should play it, even if you don't like puzzle games, maybe this one, is the one.

Also don't forget to try the co-op story mode with a buddy. Amazing package all around.
